description:
Three years ago, a gateway between Earth and the Beyond opened in New York City, trapping extradimensional creatures and humans alike in an impermeable bubble. After the city's restoration, monsters, magic, and madness are common findings in the area now known as Hellsalem's Lot. Leonardo Watch, a young photographer who unwillingly obtained the "All-seeing Eyes of the Gods" in exchange for his sister's eyesight, came to this paranormal city to find answers to the mysterious power that he possesses. He later finds his life drastically changed when he joins Libra, a secret organization of people with supernatural abilities dedicated to maintaining order in the everyday chaos of Hellsalem's Lot.

However, this is only the beginning of Leonardo's unexpected journey ahead. Regardless of the constant threat of otherworldly enemies, he is determined to uncover the secrets of his power and find a way to restore his sister's eyesight. Kekkai Sensen & Beyond follows Leonardo as he sets off on more crazy adventures with his comrades, fighting to ensure peace and order.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Parkour
tags.description: Centers around the sport of parkour.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

node.description:
Yasuhiro Nightow is a Japanese manga artist and game creator who created the anime and manga Trigun. Nightow was born in Yokohama, Japan. He moved to Yokosuka when he was in elementary school, and spent the junior high and high school years in Shizuoka.

Before the release of the popular manga, Trigun, Nightow studied social science and then majored in media studies. Nightow became popular in the US thanks to the US release of Trigun. Trigun, the TV series, had a limited broadcast run in 1998.

Nightow also created the characters and story for the Sega/Red Entertainment anime and third-person shooter video game series Gungrave.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nightow)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高柳滋仁)

Originating from [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/).

A co-founder and a board member of [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Upon graduating from high school, Kawamoto was first employed in the making and designing of precision machinery. During this early period, he became interested in becoming an animator due to the ongoing [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) series, [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/)'s [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) and [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/)'s amateur [Daicon](https://anilist.co/anime/2724/) films. In particular, [Yoshikazu Yasuhiko](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/)'s work was a major influence.

After graduating, he applied for a small sub-contracting studio called Group Donguri and was accepted. In 1986, he made his debut in Yasuhiko's 1986 film [Arion](https://anilist.co/anime/791/). During the production he was mentored by the character designer [Sachiko Kamimura](https://anilist.co/staff/112663/), with whom he would later work with on multiple occasions, including being her assistant in [Venus Wars](https://anilist.co/anime/544/), which was also written and directed by Yasuhiko. After this Kawamoto worked on numerous series by [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), most notably as a character designer on the Gundam entries, [Stardust Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/84/) and [The 08th MS Team](https://anilist.co/anime/81/), as well as the internationally acclaimed [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/).

In 1998, he co-founded Bones with fellow Sunrise staff members [Masahiko Minami](https://anilist.co/staff/101519/) and [Hiroshi Ousaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107410/). Some of the more recent works he has provided designs for include [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/), [Ghost Slayers Ayashi](https://anilist.co/anime/1587/), [Noragami](https://anilist.co/anime/20447/) and [Kekkai Sensen](https://anilist.co/anime/20727/).

**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!
- Character Design - "Gigantic Drive" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam A year of War" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Cross Dimension 0079" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam F91 Formula Senki 0122" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Return of Zion" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Senki" (Video game)
- Character Design - "OUT LIVE Be Eliminate Yesterday" (Video game)
- Character Design - "OUT LIVE" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Wonder Project J" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Robot Alchemic Drive" (Video game)
- Assistant Chief Animation Director - "OVER THE MONOCHROME RAINBOW" (Video game)
- Animation Director - "Ghost in the Shell" (Video game)
- Animation Director - "Kidou Senshi Gundam" (Video game)
- Key Animation for "Ghost in the Shell" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Cross Dimension 0079" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Kidou Senshi Gundam PERFECT ONE YEAR WAR" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Kidou Senshi Gundam" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Serial Experiments Lain" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Spiral Zone" (ep 5)!~

__Hobby:__ Basketball

__[Website](https://taisei-iwasaki.com/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2eutad3VCXdembmIgWdwjH)__

__Taisei Iwasaki__ is a Japanese musician, composer and [gekiban](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8A%87%E4%BC%B4) writer. He is known for composing music for various media like movies, dramas, commercials and anime. He mentions that his father is from Hakodate, and claims the city to be one of his favorites.

His hobby is basketball, and in regards to his hobby, he provides songs for [NBA](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBA)-programs.

name.native: ユニゾン・スクエア・ガーデン

node.description: Website | Twitter Unison Square Garden, stylized as UNISON SQUARE GARDEN, is a 3 member boy band under the record label TOY'S FACTORY (formerly under UK PROJECT). Members: - Kousuke Saitou (斎藤宏介) (Vocal & Guitar) - [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi) (田淵智也) (Vocal & Bass) - Takao Suzuki (鈴木貴雄) (Vocal & Drums) (Source: jpop.fandom.com)

__[Website](http://okamurayasuyuki.info/info/profile/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasuyuki_info/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/%E5%B2%A1%E6%9D%91%E9%9D%96%E5%B9%B8-%E5%85%AC%E5%BC%8F%E3%82%B5%E3%82%A4%E3%83%88-221960977820152/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/yasuyukiINFO)__

__Birthplace:__ Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Yasuyuki Okamura, alternatively known by his pen name Eitarou Isono is a Japanese singer-songwriter, model and music producer who is active in the Japanese music market. He began his professional career in 1985, and is internationally known for the _[City Hunter 2](https://anilist.co/anime/1471/City-Hunter-2)_ ending theme '[Super Girl](https://anidb.net/song/30791)', and for the _[Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/SpaceDandy)_ opening theme '[Viva Namida](https://anidb.net/song/64362)'.

__Biography:__
Yasuyuki was born in Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan in 1965, he is the oldest of two children. His father worked for Air France, and as a result, his family moved frequently throughout Japan, resulting in him rotating between seven elementary schools and junior high schools. He attended Niigata Higashi High School and formed his first band there, but dropped out in the 11th grade to pursue a musical career while working part-time at the nightclub Hacoban. after sending out numerous demo tapes, and doing composing work for other artists, he was finally signed by Epic Sony in 1986.

Yasuyuki was highly successful in the late 1980s and the early 1990s, first promoted to the world as a teen idol. He also claimed that during this time he was most inspired by the singers [Seiko Matsuda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seiko_Matsuda) and [Prince](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_(musician)). He starred in the film _Peach I'll Do Anything For You_ (Peach-どんなことをしてほしいのぼくに) alongside Kahori Fujii and Kazuhiko Kanayama. In 1996, he fell back from the media and performing in general, and started to focus more on producing other artists, including Meg and Chara.

Yasuyuki was arrested in 2003 for possession of stimulant drugs, but released after pleading that the drugs were a necessary medicine. His record contract with Epic Sony was terminated by the company, and he was later signed by Universal. In April 2005, he was arrested again, but this time for attempting to use cocaine in a Shibuya record store bathroom, and for this he was sentenced to two years in prison. When returning in 2007, he started a comeback visually similar to his 1980s look, but was arrested again on February 5, 2008 for possession of crystal meth. He was sentenced to another two years in prison, and he then proceeded to return live in Tokyo in 2010. He began releasing demos on his official Myspace page, back then.

In 2011, Yasuyuki begun an official tour again and released a two-part self cover album. Etiquette Pink and Etiquette Purple. He returned to producing other artists and touring, and begun to speak openly about becoming fully sober. In 2013, he released his first single in six years, titled '[Viva Namida](https://anidb.net/song/64362)', which was revealed to become the opening theme to the Shinichiro Watanabe's _[Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/SpaceDandy/staff)_. In the music video for this single, an anime version of Yasuyuki dances and sings along with the Space Dandy cast. In 2014 he toured Japan.

In 2017, he alongside [TeddyLoid](https://anilist.co/staff/130673/TeddyLoid), [Kenshi Yonezu](https://anilist.co/staff/126835/Kenshi-Yonezu) and [DAOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/123235/DAOKO) released a 14 track album titled "[Thank You Blue](https://anidb.net/collection/11407)", featuring the ending theme song from [Takayanagi Shigehito](https://anilist.co/staff/105553)'s directed [Kekkai Sensen & Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/97886/Kekkai-Sensen--BEYOND/) titled '[Step Up Love](https://anidb.net/song/93942)'.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuyuki_Okamura))

[Website](http://daoko.jp/) | [Blog](http://daoko.life/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/daok0) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daoko_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIzc1_X3OAFquArF3EOVeWw) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/daok0) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@daoko.official) __Introduction:__ DAOKO is a Japanese female vocalist, rapper and lyricist. She first gained popularity in 2012, at the age of 15, when one of her uploaded videos on Nico Nico Douga received attention. Biography: DAOKO released her first album, *"Hyper Girl: Mukougawa no Onna no Ko"* in December 2012 through *Low High Who? Production*. In December 2013 she released a sophomore album titled *"GRAVITY"*. She received a lot of attention for her collaboration with TeddyLoid for *"Me!Me!Me!"* (a song featured in an animated short for [Nihon Animator Mihonichi](https://anilist.co/anime/20947)) in November 2014. DAOKO was nominated for Next Break Artist at the MTV Video Music Awards Japan 2015. DAOKO left *Low High Who? Production* after releasing her album *"Dimension"* in February 2015, and subsequently shut down her blog. She released her self-titled album *"DAOKO"* via *Toy's Factory* a month later. DAOKO started her first tour in January 2016. In December 2017 she released the album *"THANK YOU BLUE"*. In December 2018 she released *"私的旅行 (Shiteki Ryouko)"*. In October 2019 she collaborated with mobile game *Dragalia Lost* to release *"DAOKO×Dragalia Lost"*. DAOKO's 2017 single *"Uchiage Hanabi"* for Studio Shaft's anime movie [Uchiage Hanabi, Shita kara Miru ka? Yoko kara Miru ka?](https://anilist.co/anime/97908) is the most viewed anime song on YouTube, with over 400 million views. She won the *2018 Space Shower Music Award* in the Song of the Year category for *"Uchiage Hanabi"*, and in the Best Breakthrough Artist category. In July 2020 she released the album *"anima"*.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sekise10) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yutaka_nakamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村豊_(アニメーター%29)

Yutaka Nakamura graduated from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and first joined studio Ad Cosmo. After switching several studios; from Art Office Sharaku, to Anime Torotoro, to [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), he eventually settled at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) with a contract.

Nakamura is considered to be among the best action animators, with his scenes featuring catchy movement and effects. Some of his recognizable traits include camera shaking, blurs, and bending and stretching high-speed objects. His fights are praised for its weighty, intense choreographies that are heavy on impact frames. His signature trait is drawing debris as simple cubes, consequentially named "Yutapon Cubes," which are stylistic and easy to draw. Despite being responsible for popularizing it, Nakamura has stated that he started doing it when he noticed [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) doing it. 

(Source: Animators Wiki)

__Likes:__ Fried Chicken and Clams
__Dislikes:__ Tomatoes and Natto

__Introduction:__
Tomoya Tabuchi is a Japanese musician, lyricist, bassist, composer and arranger. He is in charge of the bass and chorus for the three-piece rock band [UNISON SQUARE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden), and for the rock band [THE KEBABS](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/THE_KEBABS), he also takes part in the [Q-MHz](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q-MHz) music production team.

__Biography:__
Tomoya is the same age as the two other UNISON SQUARE GARDEN members, Kousuke Saito (斎藤宏介) who is also a high school and university classmate, and Suzuki Takao (鈴木貴雄) who is an elementary school classmate. In elementary school, he was obsessed with soccer, to the point that he'd become a "soccer boy". His future dream at the time, was to become a junior league soccer player. Band member Suzuki Takao participated in the same soccer club, as well. When he was in fifth grade of elementary school, he had to move from Funabashi City, Chiba to Setagaya-ku, Tokyo due to his father's work.

In later years he graduated from the Faculty of Political Science and Economics at Waseda University. His specialized field is finance theory.

__Dislikes:__ Tomatoes and Natto

In April 2005, he was arrested again, but this time for attempting to use cocaine in a Shibuya record store bathroom, and for this he was sentenced to two years in prison. When returning in 2007, he started a comeback visually similar to his 1980s look, but was arrested again on February 5, 2008 for possession of crystal meth. He was sentenced to another two years in prison, and he then proceeded to return live in Tokyo in 2010. He began releasing demos on his official Myspace page, back then.

In 2011, Yasuyuki begun an official tour again and released a two-part self cover album. Etiquette Pink and Etiquette Purple. He returned to producing other artists and touring, and begun to speak openly about becoming fully sober. In 2013, he released his first single in six years, titled '[Viva Namida](https://anidb.net/song/64362)', which was revealed to become the opening theme to the Shinichiro Watanabe's _[Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/SpaceDandy/staff)_. In the music video for this single, an anime version of Yasuyuki dances and sings along with the Space Dandy cast. In 2014 he toured Japan.

In 2017, he alongside [TeddyLoid](https://anilist.co/staff/130673/TeddyLoid), [Kenshi Yonezu](https://anilist.co/staff/126835/Kenshi-Yonezu) and [DAOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/123235/DAOKO) released a 14 track album titled "[Thank You Blue](https://anidb.net/collection/11407)", featuring the ending theme song from [Takayanagi Shigehito](https://anilist.co/staff/105553)'s directed [Kekkai Sensen & Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/97886/Kekkai-Sensen--BEYOND/) titled '[Step Up Love](https://anidb.net/song/93942)'.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuyuki_Okamura))

__[Website](http://okamurayasuyuki.info/info/profile/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasuyuki_info/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/%E5%B2%A1%E6%9D%91%E9%9D%96%E5%B9%B8-%E5%85%AC%E5%BC%8F%E3%82%B5%E3%82%A4%E3%83%88-221960977820152/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/yasuyukiINFO)__

__Birthplace:__ Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Yasuyuki Okamura, alternatively known by his pen name Eitarou Isono is a Japanese singer-songwriter, model and music producer who is active in the Japanese music market. He began his professional career in 1985, and is internationally known for the _[City Hunter 2](https://anilist.co/anime/1471/City-Hunter-2)_ ending theme '[Super Girl](https://anidb.net/song/30791)', and for the _[Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/SpaceDandy)_ opening theme '[Viva Namida](https://anidb.net/song/64362)'.

__Biography:__
Yasuyuki was born in Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan in 1965, he is the oldest of two children. His father worked for Air France, and as a result, his family moved frequently throughout Japan, resulting in him rotating between seven elementary schools and junior high schools. He attended Niigata Higashi High School and formed his first band there, but dropped out in the 11th grade to pursue a musical career while working part-time at the nightclub Hacoban. after sending out numerous demo tapes, and doing composing work for other artists, he was finally signed by Epic Sony in 1986.

Yasuyuki was highly successful in the late 1980s and the early 1990s, first promoted to the world as a teen idol. He also claimed that during this time he was most inspired by the singers [Seiko Matsuda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seiko_Matsuda) and [Prince](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_(musician)). He starred in the film _Peach I'll Do Anything For You_ (Peach-どんなことをしてほしいのぼくに) alongside Kahori Fujii and Kazuhiko Kanayama. In 1996, he fell back from the media and performing in general, and started to focus more on producing other artists, including Meg and Chara.

Yasuyuki was arrested in 2003 for possession of stimulant drugs, but released after pleading that the drugs were a necessary medicine. His record contract with Epic Sony was terminated by the company, and he was later signed by Universal. In April 2005, he was arrested again, but this time for attempting to use cocaine in a Shibuya record store bathroom, and for this he was sentenced to two years in prison. When returning in 2007, he started a comeback visually similar to his 1980s look, but was arrested again on February 5, 2008 for possession of crystal meth. He was sentenced to another two years in prison, and he then proceeded to return live in Tokyo in 2010. He began releasing demos on his official Myspace page, back then.

In 2011, Yasuyuki begun an official tour again and released a two-part self cover album. Etiquette Pink and Etiquette Purple. He returned to producing other artists and touring, and begun to speak openly about becoming fully sober. In 2013, he released his first single in six years, titled '[Viva Namida](https://anidb.net/song/64362)', which was revealed to become the opening theme to the Shinichiro Watanabe's _[Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/SpaceDandy/staff)_. In the music video for this single, an anime version of Yasuyuki dances and sings along with the Space Dandy cast. In 2014 he toured Japan.

In 2017, he alongside [TeddyLoid](https://anilist.co/staff/130673/TeddyLoid), [Kenshi Yonezu](https://anilist.co/staff/126835/Kenshi-Yonezu) and [DAOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/123235/DAOKO) released a 14 track album titled "[Thank You Blue](https://anidb.net/collection/11407)", featuring the ending theme song from [Takayanagi Shigehito](https://anilist.co/staff/105553)'s directed [Kekkai Sensen & Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/97886/Kekkai-Sensen--BEYOND/) titled '[Step Up Love](https://anidb.net/song/93942)'.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuyuki_Okamura))

[Website](http://daoko.jp/) | [Blog](http://daoko.life/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/daok0) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daoko_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIzc1_X3OAFquArF3EOVeWw) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/daok0) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@daoko.official) __Introduction:__ DAOKO is a Japanese female vocalist, rapper and lyricist. She first gained popularity in 2012, at the age of 15, when one of her uploaded videos on Nico Nico Douga received attention. Biography: DAOKO released her first album, *"Hyper Girl: Mukougawa no Onna no Ko"* in December 2012 through *Low High Who? Production*. In December 2013 she released a sophomore album titled *"GRAVITY"*. She received a lot of attention for her collaboration with TeddyLoid for *"Me!Me!Me!"* (a song featured in an animated short for [Nihon Animator Mihonichi](https://anilist.co/anime/20947)) in November 2014. DAOKO was nominated for Next Break Artist at the MTV Video Music Awards Japan 2015. DAOKO left *Low High Who? Production* after releasing her album *"Dimension"* in February 2015, and subsequently shut down her blog. She released her self-titled album *"DAOKO"* via *Toy's Factory* a month later. DAOKO started her first tour in January 2016. In December 2017 she released the album *"THANK YOU BLUE"*. In December 2018 she released *"私的旅行 (Shiteki Ryouko)"*. In October 2019 she collaborated with mobile game *Dragalia Lost* to release *"DAOKO×Dragalia Lost"*. DAOKO's 2017 single *"Uchiage Hanabi"* for Studio Shaft's anime movie [Uchiage Hanabi, Shita kara Miru ka? Yoko kara Miru ka?](https://anilist.co/anime/97908) is the most viewed anime song on YouTube, with over 400 million views. She won the *2018 Space Shower Music Award* in the Song of the Year category for *"Uchiage Hanabi"*, and in the Best Breakthrough Artist category. In July 2020 she released the album *"anima"*.

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Known to prescore his works.

Studied under [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/) on [JoJo's Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/666/), [Perfect Blue](https://anilist.co/anime/437/) and [Millenium Actress](https://anilist.co/anime/1033/).
